message_1: What is the daughter nuclide produced when the radioactive decay of uranium-238 undergoes alpha decay three times in a row?
message_2:
When uranium-238 (U-238) undergoes alpha decay, it emits an alpha particle, which consists of 2 protons and 2 neutrons. After three consecutive alpha decays, the original nuclide will lose a total of 6 protons and 6 neutrons.

Uranium-238 has 92 protons and 146 neutrons. After three alpha decays:

Number of protons: 92 - 6 = 86
Number of neutrons: 146 - 6 = 140

The resulting nuclide has 86 protons and 140 neutrons, which corresponds to radon-222 (Rn-222). So, the daughter nuclide produced after uranium-238 undergoes alpha decay three times in a row is radon-222.
